The Damnoen Saduak Floating Market Tour takes you to the most popular floating market in Thailand. Hop onto a decorated long-tail boat and glide down the narrow canals hunting for exotic fruit and vegetable deals. Peek at the small houses on stilts that line the shore and discover Thailand's traditional peaceful lifestyle contrasted to the hectic buzz of the river market. Pick up a few souvenirs and take stunning pictures of the winding waterways – this truly is a one-of-a-kind experience.

At Ancient Siam, you'll feel as if you've walked through the entire Thailand in a day. The 'city', one of the largest outdoor museums in the world, is essentially a scaled-down version of the country, with many replicas and reconstructions of Thailand's historically significant structures. See temples, palaces, and shrines, and feel transported back in time as you make your way around the grounds. A colossal, three-headed elephant dominates the structure of The Erawan Museum. The attraction houses a variety of collections owned by museum owner Khun Lek Viriyapant, offering a look into local heritage, customs and craftsmanship. Both inside and out, it's a fascinating space and well worth a visit.

Visit the ancient city of Ayutthaya, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and once the capital of Thailand Walk through the mystical city of Ayutthaya, and marvel at the ancient ruins and structures around the city Learn about the rich, enchanting history of Buddhism with visits to Wat Yai Chaimongkon, Wihan Phra Mongkhon Bophit and Wat Phra Si Sanphet Savor a delicious local lunch at a riverside restaurant Discover the former glory and grandeur of Ayutthaya with a visit to Bang Pa-In Summer Palace Walk through the mystical city of Ayutthaya, and marvel at the ancient ruins and structures around the city Walk through the mystical city of Ayutthaya, and marvel at the ancient ruins and structures around the city Learn about the rich, enchanting history of Buddhism with visits to Wat Yai Chaimongkon, Wihan Phra Mongkhon Bophit and Wat Phra Si Sanphet Learn about the rich, enchanting history of Buddhism with visits to Wat Yai Chaimongkon, Wihan Phra Mongkhon Bophit and Wat Phra Si Sanphet Savor a delicious local lunch at a riverside restaurant Savor a delicious local lunch at a riverside restaurant Discover the former glory and grandeur of Ayutthaya with a visit to Bang Pa-In Summer Palace Discover the former glory and grandeur of Ayutthaya with a visit to Bang Pa-In Summer Palace What We Love:   What We Love: The Ayutthaya Experience takes you through the historical wonders of Thailand's ancient capital. Ayutthaya is dotted with ruins and grand temples, surrounded by the Chao Phraya, Pa Sak and Lop Buri Rivers, and filled with the aura of mystique and grandeur that truly reflects ancient Thailand. Stop by a 17th century summer palace a fusion of Italian, Thai and Chinese architecture. Visit Wat Yai Chaimongkon, a temple-home to a large reclining Buddha covered in saffron robes. Then drop by the equally intriguing Phra Mongkhon Bophit, a large, bronze-cast Buddha outside the Grand Palace, before being served a hearty lunch at a riverside restaurant. Head to the Wat Phra Si Sanphet, where within its pagodas are enshrined the ashes of three Ayutthayan kings. Roam the Inner City afterward, with glimpses of many a magnificent temple and ruin, wrapping up your journey into olden Thailand.

Blue Elephant fine dining restaurant offers some of Bangkok's most popular cooking classes, under the competent guidance of experienced chefs. Cruise down the Chao Praya river Tour around 'Dessert' Island by bike Get a special lesson in pottery making Learn about the island's desserts on a canal cruise Cruise down the Chao Praya river Cruise down the Chao Praya river Tour around 'Dessert' Island by bike Tour around 'Dessert' Island by bike Get a special lesson in pottery making Get a special lesson in pottery making Learn about the island's desserts on a canal cruise Learn about the island's desserts on a canal cruise What We Love:   What We Love: If the big city of Bangkok is proving to be a little intense for you, then a short city escape to Koh Kret or "Dessert Island" maybe just what the doctor ordered. Situated on a canal, Koh Kret is a haven of local life, luscious greenery and local specialities. Let the wind rustle your hair as you sail down river before arriving at the island to start the 7km bike ride around the island. Along the way meet and greet the locals, before stopping at an artisan village to get a class in pottery making. Master the wheel and create yourself a piece of pottery with your own special touch. After lunch trade your peddles for a paddle and set out on a canal trip into the 'dessert' canal where you will learn about and try to make some of the sweet treats produced on this island. Finally check out the floating market before heading back to the big city.

See the atmosphere change as the sun goes down and local food stalls line the streets. Sample authentic Thai cuisine and don't forget to pick up a few souvenirs.

Discover Thailand's first ever national park – the beautiful Khao Yai – on an all-day tour from Bangkok and see exotic animals and birds with the backdrop of the evergreen forest Visit Thailand's first national park - Khao Yai - stretching over an area of 2,168 square kilometers Breathe in the fresh air of the evergreen forest and diverse vegetation – up to 2,500 species Catch a glimpse of exotic animals, birds, crocodiles, elephants and more – the reserve is home to 60 mammals and 300 bird species Khao Yai National Park is a great spot to discover nature with family and friends Visit Thailand's first national park - Khao Yai - stretching over an area of 2,168 square kilometers Visit Thailand's first national park - Khao Yai - stretching over an area of 2,168 square kilometers Breathe in the fresh air of the evergreen forest and diverse vegetation – up to 2,500 species Breathe in the fresh air of the evergreen forest and diverse vegetation – up to 2,500 species Catch a glimpse of exotic animals, birds, crocodiles, elephants and more – the reserve is home to 60 mammals and 300 bird species Catch a glimpse of exotic animals, birds, crocodiles, elephants and more – the reserve is home to 60 mammals and 300 bird species Khao Yai National Park is a great spot to discover nature with family and friends Khao Yai National Park is a great spot to discover nature with family and friends What We Love:   What We Love: Discover the true beauty of Thailand's nature in its first national park – Khao Yai, covering an area of 2,168 square kilometers in four provinces: Prachin Buri, Nakhon Ratchasima, Nakhon Nayok, and Saraburi. Located just two hours away from Bangkok, Khao Yai is one of the country's best-known natural reserves, making it the perfect escape into nature, just a day trip from Bangkok. Discover the evergreen forest, breathe in the fresh air with exotic flower scents and listen out for the park's friendly inhabitants: hornbills, trogons and cuckoos – just to name a few. The park is home to up to 2,500 plant species, 60 mammals and 300 bird species. Sightings of wild elephants, crocodiles and other creatures in their natural habitat are not rare too! Your visit to the park will also include a 30-minute elephant ride and a fun visit to Chokchai Farm.

Discover the ancient city of Ayutthaya, the former royal capital, on a 3-4 hour biking adventure Admire the beautiful local scenery and some of Thailand's best known historical landmarks Visit Ayutthaya Historical Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1991, Pom Phet (known as 'Diamond Fortress'), Wat Phra Sri Sanphet, Wat Mahathat and more Explore the rich local culture and cuisine at a street market Discover the ancient city of Ayutthaya, the former royal capital, on a 3-4 hour biking adventure Discover the ancient city of Ayutthaya, the former royal capital, on a 3-4 hour biking adventure Admire the beautiful local scenery and some of Thailand's best known historical landmarks Admire the beautiful local scenery and some of Thailand's best known historical landmarks Visit Ayutthaya Historical Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1991, Pom Phet (known as 'Diamond Fortress'), Wat Phra Sri Sanphet, Wat Mahathat and more Visit Ayutthaya Historical Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1991, Pom Phet (known as 'Diamond Fortress'), Wat Phra Sri Sanphet, Wat Mahathat and more Explore the rich local culture and cuisine at a street market Explore the rich local culture and cuisine at a street market What We Love:   What We Love: This tour takes you on a discovery adventure around Phra Nakhon Si Ayutthaya – the Sacred City of Ayutthaya, founded in 1350 and proudly holding the title of the Siamese royal capital until 1767. The first stop of the biking tour invites you to Pom Phet, also known as 'Diamond Fortress'. You will then explore local neighbourhoods on the way to 'Roti Road', where you will get to taste signature Thai delicacies recommended by your experienced guide. Cycle though the calm Somdet Phra Srinakarinda Park to the next stop at Chedi Phra Si Suriyothai memorial where you will have time to take loads of memorable photos before heading out to visit a Muslim community, Ayutthaya Historical Park and two of Thailand's well-known temples: Wat Phra Sri Sanphet and Wat Mahathat. The Ayutthaya biking adventure concludes with a shopping spree at a local market and a ferry across Palak River before making your own way to your next destination.

Spend a day soaking up the wartime history near Bangkok at Kanchanaburi, site of the bridge over the River Kwai and Death Railway Stop by the infamous bridge over the River Kwai and take a death defying ride on the Death Railway Visit the War Cemetery, resting-place for over 6,000 Allied prisoners and the Jeath War Museum to learn more about the happenings of 1942 under Japanese control Swim and soak in the sun at the awe-inspiring Saiyoknoi Waterfall Enjoy a bamboo rafting ride and elephant trek included The perfect day trip from Bangkok for history buffs Stop by the infamous bridge over the River Kwai and take a death defying ride on the Death Railway Stop by the infamous bridge over the River Kwai and take a death defying ride on the Death Railway Visit the War Cemetery, resting-place for over 6,000 Allied prisoners and the Jeath War Museum to learn more about the happenings of 1942 under Japanese control Visit the War Cemetery, resting-place for over 6,000 Allied prisoners and the Jeath War Museum to learn more about the happenings of 1942 under Japanese control Swim and soak in the sun at the awe-inspiring Saiyoknoi Waterfall Swim and soak in the sun at the awe-inspiring Saiyoknoi Waterfall Enjoy a bamboo rafting ride and elephant trek included Enjoy a bamboo rafting ride and elephant trek included The perfect day trip from Bangkok for history buffs The perfect day trip from Bangkok for history buffs What We Love:   What We Love: Drive out to Kanchanaburi, Thailand's third largest province, located west of Bangkok, and spend a day taking in the turbulent history of the area. You'll first visit the bridge over the River Kwai, a historical landmark that is part of the Death Railway built by Allied prisoners of war, under control of the Japanese in 1942. You'll also visit the Jeath War Museum to enhance your knowledge and the War Cemetery where thousands of POWs were laid to rest. After a local lunch you'll end the day with a bamboo rafting ride, an elephant trek and time to soak up the beauty of Kanchanburi at the cascading Saiyoknoi Waterfall.

Ride through a quiet neighbourhood and stop at the local street food market where your private guide will explain the history of local dishes. At noon, you will relax over a light Thai lunch and go on to visit Ayutthaya's signature Buddhist temples: Wat Mahathat and Wat Pra Sri Sanphet. Ride though the local market where you will get to discover Thailand's cuisine in all its richness and sample fried and baked local delicacies. The tour of the temples then continues with a stop over at Luang Phor Lokayasuttha – home to the biggest reclining Buddha in Ayutthaya. Your trip will conclude with the crossing of the Chao Phraya River before you make your way to your next destination, to Bangkok or stay on in Ayutthaya.

Watch this dazzling show of cabaret, dance and song paying homage to national performances from across the globe and brought to life by stunningly beautiful Thai ladyboys Watch spectacular performers, impressive costumes and amazing set design This internationally acclaimed show rates highly amongst the world's top shows Choose your preferred theatre seating to be close to the stage or getting an overview from further back Watch spectacular performers, impressive costumes and amazing set design Watch spectacular performers, impressive costumes and amazing set design This internationally acclaimed show rates highly amongst the world's top shows This internationally acclaimed show rates highly amongst the world's top shows Choose your preferred theatre seating to be close to the stage or getting an overview from further back Choose your preferred theatre seating to be close to the stage or getting an overview from further back What We Love:   What We Love: ‘Tiffany's Show' is the original transvestite cabaret show in Pattaya, a uniquely Thai production now in its 40th year. Originating as a one-man show performed for friends on New Year's Eve in 1974, it has now expanded into one of Thailand's most famed performances. Catering to audiences from across the globe, it was voted number four in a list of the world's Top Ten Best Shows. The incredible talents of the transvestite and transgender community, drawn from all corners of the Thai kingdom, are showcased in a display of spectacular exotic scenes, enhanced by the latest lighting and sound technology. Extravagant costumes, toe tapping choreography, and beautiful ‘showgirls' will ensure your night at Tiffany's is one to remember.

This extensive tour of the northern Thai province begins with a stop at the Mae Khajan Hot Springs and the nearby Wat Rong Khun. Also known as the White Temple, Wat Rong Khun is known best for its incredible white structure, intricate in detail and eerie in thematic references. You'll then be whisked away to the cross point of Thailand, Laos and Myanmar. The opportunity to sail down the Mekong River awaits, toward the Laotian island of Don Sao. From there, head to Mae Sai, the border down near Myanmar where you'll get to enjoy a mini market shopping spree. Then head back to the city center of Chiang Mai, but not before making a stop at the villages of Akha and Yao Hill Tribes, and getting to know a thing or two about their day-to-day lives and cultural practices.

Walk up to the thunderous Wachiritharn and Siritharn Waterfalls, and take a look at the agricultural work of the Royal Project Research Station. Continue on amidst forest greenery until you get to the King and Queen's chedis, where you'll find some of the best views of the park, and then proceed to the top of Doi Inthanon, the highest mountain in Thailand, where even more spectacular panoramas await. A nature walk follows along the Angkha Trail, before you arrive at a Karen and Hmong Ethnic Village, then work your way back down to end your full day spent in nature.

Explore fascinating landmarks in this journey, featuring the White Temple, the Black House, and the city of Chiang Rai on a day tour from Chiang Mai See the beautifully eerie and intricate Wat Rong Khun, also known as the White Temple, designed by National Artist Chalermchai Kositpipat Stop by the Black House, a museum and the home of National Artist Dr. Thawan Duchanee, and see its incredible interiors and bone displays Enjoy a delicious local lunch to fuel your journey See the beautifully eerie and intricate Wat Rong Khun, also known as the White Temple, designed by National Artist Chalermchai Kositpipat See the beautifully eerie and intricate Wat Rong Khun, also known as the White Temple, designed by National Artist Chalermchai Kositpipat Stop by the Black House, a museum and the home of National Artist Dr. Thawan Duchanee, and see its incredible interiors and bone displays Stop by the Black House, a museum and the home of National Artist Dr. Thawan Duchanee, and see its incredible interiors and bone displays Enjoy a delicious local lunch to fuel your journey Enjoy a delicious local lunch to fuel your journey What We Love:   What We Love: Be captivated by the incredible sights of Chiang Rai in this day exploration. Visit Wat Rong Khun, the spectacular White Temple known for its hauntingly beautiful blend of cultural and contemporary details. Designed by Thai National Artist Chalermchai Kositpipat, the temple features an entrance with outstretched hands, Predator jutting from the ground, as well as a number of other pop culture references within the dazzling white structure. Then head off to the Black House, a museum and also the home of the National Artist Dr. Thawan Duchanee. There you'll find a complex of dark and eerily designed buildings, filled with bones, skulls, fur and feathers, displayed and arranged as though an exhibit, but also as homely ornamentation. It's a fascinating immersion in the Thai north, one that captivates with its beauty, as well as its mystery.
